definition: (coll.) to grab money/to rake in money
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to get money/to accumulate money
to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to make extra money
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to swindle/to cheat
speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
to work half-heartedly/to get by in a job with the minimum effort
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
